basedOn.display: MRI BRACH PLEX & AXIL WOW CONT

valueString:
1. T2 hyperintense peripheral nerve masses involving all left cervical and visualized upper thoracic foraminal and extraforaminal nerves, the largest at C3 measuring 7 cm. Favored for peripheral nerve sheath tumors such as schwannomas. Neurofibromas could have a similar appearance.
2. Probable involvement of the brachial plexus to the level of the upper and lower trunks with sparing of the distal portions.
3. Additional subcutaneous, intramuscular, and submucosal lesions detailed.




 Approved by Bryce Hansen, M.D. on 10/28/2019 4:15 PM


By my electronic signature, I attest that I have personally reviewed the images for this examination and formulated the interpretations and opinions expressed in this report




 Finalized by Nicholas Harn, M.D. on 10/28/2019 4:21 PM. Dictated by Bryce Hansen, M.D. on 10/28/2019 3:22 PM.
